skillsCard.text: HTML5 is the latest version of the Hypertext Markup Language, the code that describes web pages. It allows embedding multimedia, making websites more interactive and dynamic, and is essential for modern web development.

CSS3 is the latest version of the Cascading Style Sheets language. It is used to control the layout, design, and appearance of websites. It includes advanced features like animations, transitions, and responsive design capabilities.

JavaScript is a programming language that enables dynamic behavior on web pages. It is essential for client-side functionality, such as interactive forms, animations, and handling user input. It works well with HTML and CSS to create interactive websites.

Vue.js is a progressive JavaScript framework used to build modern web applications. It focuses on the view layer and is known for its simplicity, flexibility, and ease of integration with other libraries or existing projects.

Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its easy-to-read syntax and versatility. It is widely used for web development, data analysis, machine learning, and automation tasks.

Django is a high-level Python framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design. It is used to build robust, secure, and scalable web applications and follows the DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) principle.
